org.intermine.web.logic.widget

Class ErrorCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.intermine.web.logic.widget.ErrorCorrection

  • public final class ErrorCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
    See online help docs for detailed description of what error correction is and why we need it. Briefly, in all experiments certain things happen that look interesting but really just happened by chance. We need to account for this phenomenon to ensure our numbers are interesting behaviour and not just random happenstance. To do this we take all of our p-values and adjust them. Here we are using on of our two methods available - which one we use is determined by the user.

      • adjustPValues

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> adjustPValues(java.lang.String errorCorrection,
                                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> results,
                                                                 java.lang.Double max,
                                                                 int testCount)
        Parameters:
        testCount - number of tests, eg. total number of go terms in database
        results - map of term to p-value
        max - maximum value to display, selected by user
        errorCorrection - which error correction to use
        Returns:
        map containing adjusted p-values
